page.title: 06Leisure in Kirmington
page.content: PLAYING FIELD.Given by Lord Yarborough (Y) to the village it has a play area with swings & a climbing frame.There is also a football pitch used by the two village teams. VILLAGE HALL.Originally the Methodist chapel,it was offered to the village by Lord Y. at a peppercorn rent in 1976.After fund raising & alterations it was brought into use in April 1983 BOWLS.The site is leased to the Humber -side County Bowls Development Associ- ation by Lord Y. It is the only one of it's kind in the Country.The site has two greens and a pavilion. KIRMINGTON COUNTRY CLUB.It was built in 1978 on privately owned land.The building contains 7 squash courts,2 snooker tables,saunas &sunbed.Outside is a tennis court.It has widespread membership,and it's own football team. SHOOTING CLUBS use old pit,and quarry.
